body:
Let's explain the improvement of performance case by case. 
## Target case
Iotdb has lots of tsfile and each tsfile contains some time series. A query want to select some of the time series and these time series aren't present in most of the tsfiles.
## Analyze
1. For one tsfile
     Suppose this tsfile contains 10000 timeseries, and each series has only one chunk in the file.
     In this case, if we try to read a time series that not belong to the 10000 series, 
     (1) Without Bloom Filter, we have to read tsfile's FileMetadata and related TsDeviceMetadata, which costs 124ms;
     (2) Using Bloom Filter, we just need to read  tsfile's FileMetadata (BF included), which costs 4ms.

2. For iotdb

    This analyze maybe very complex for iotdb has lru cache to cache chunk metadata. So when a query comes, for a specific tsfile there will be three possibilities. Let's say the time of loading metadata is t1, the time of using bloom filter is t2, the time of querying cache is t3, and cache and bloom filter will always hit.

    Suppose all queried paths belong to the same device.

## Three possibilities 
####   This tsfile contains all of the time series.

Time with bloom filter = t3 + t2 + t1 + (n - 1) * t3

Time without bloom filter = t3 + t1 + (n - 1) * t3

Once the data is loaded from disk (time cost: t1), the data will be cached. That's why time cost is (n - 1) * t3 for the query on 2nd ~ nth path.

overhead : t2
####   This tsfile contains k (>0) of the time series.
Suppose the first queried path exists in the file.
Time with bloom filter  = t3 + t2 + t1 +  (n - k) * (t3 + t2)  + (k - 1) * t3

Time without bloom filter = t3 + t1 + (n - k) * (t3 + t1) + (k - 1 ) * t3

saving time : (n - k) * (t1 - t2)  - t2

####    This tsfile contains none of the time series.
Time with bloom filter  = n * (t3 + t2)
Time without bloom filter = n * (t3 + t1)
saving time : n * (t1 - t2)

As we have tried t1 may >= 124ms, while t2 ~= 4ms, the improvement should be good.

You answer the client's `show version` sql by refering to a constant string in jdbc:
```
static final String GLOBAL_DB_VERSION = "0.9.0-SNAPSHOT";
```
That way, your current realization is actually showing the version of jdbc, not the server.

Maybe you should develop `show client version` and `show server version` to handle the two different versions. Or just `show version` but return both the client's and the server's versions.

What do other guys think?
This pr is now too messy:(. I plan to close it and open a new one based on the current master.

i think the client version is show in shell ，like ./iotdb-client.sh -v ！
when you connect to server ，“show version” command is an sql，must return from server side

@LeiRui @liutaohua this is a server version. Returned JDBC version is before I force-push, I have already changed it. It actually uses
```java
IoTDBConstant.VERSION
```

> @LeiRui @liutaohua this is a server version. Returned JDBC version is before I force-push, I have already changed it. It actually uses
> 
> ```java
> IoTDBConstant.VERSION

Got it. Thanks for your hard work.
I still have some suggestions:
1. If you change rpc.thrift, remember to update the rpc-changelist.md under the service-rpc module.
2. What about just disabling the `getDatabaseProductVersion()` method by throw an exception? Since the now returned result `VERSION` is meaningless anyway and this method is not used anywhere.
3. You better add some tests in the `IoTDBMetadataFetchIT`.

Besides, I find that the server version will appear in the client shell:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33376433/68041948-b2a36b80-fd0c-11e9-9305-66ed392a5fb6.png)
So I wonder if the user specifically wants to get the version information using jdbc? We better clarify what the user really wants.
By the way, let's can call it a day :)  You can reply me tomorrow.

2. done

Good job. To be perfect, I expect you to add another test in the `IoTDBMetadataFetchIT` similar to `showTimeseriesTest1` and `showStorageGroupTest`, because if you have noticed, these two tests use `statement.execute(sql)` instead of `databaseMetaData.getColumns`.
By the way, please help rename `showTimeseriesTest1` to `showTimeseriesTest` for clarity.

> why not add the commit id within version?

show version is for users, not developers.

Use case:
Suppose client-0.9.0 could connect both server-0.8.0 and server-0.9.0. And we add a sql in 0.9.0, users need to decide which sql they use based on the version.

Therefore, commit id is not needed.
Btw, I suggest you change the title of this pr to be more precise and concrete.

> Btw, I suggest you change the title of this pr to be more precise and concrete.

ok。 thank you

> It looks good to me. But should we support paths with wildcards "*" in this query?

From my opinion, I think there is no need to support this.
By `show child paths <null>|<prefixPath>`, we know exactly where we are standing and just want to know what paths exist in the next level.

I can show a running result here.
Good job.

> What kind of title do you suggest? I don't think "Make paths can concatenate" is a bad title.

 I still insist my opinion. There are many ways to make paths concatenate. For example, when executing `select s1,s2 from root.sg.d0`, the query executor will concatenate the prefix path `root.sg.d0` with the two suffix paths `s1`&`s2`. That's why I think `Make paths can concatenate" is not a good title.

If you need suggestions, I would say like "**support multiple timeseries selection using curly braces in the WHERE clause**".

> Is the "reading TsFile-0.8.0" bug fixed?
fixed, when a tsfile is old version, we consider this tsfile a complete file. We would generate totalChunkNum using tsDeviceMetaData and set invalidChunkNum as 0.
related file:
tsfile/src/test/java/org/apache/iotdb/tsfile/file/metadata/TsFileMetaDataTest.java
tsfile/src/main/java/org/apache/iotdb/tsfile/read/TsFileSequenceReader.java
tsfile/src/main/java/org/apache/iotdb/tsfile/file/metadata/TsFileMetaData.java

Others
- `MAX_HEAP_SIZE` or `HEAP_NEWSIZE` are described in the `环境配置项` of `4-Config Manual.md`, but I can't find them in `iotdb-env.bat`.
- In the "系统配置项" of `4-Config Manual.md`, `tsfile-format.properties` is still referenced, but isn't it already merged into `iotdb-engine.properties`?
- `back_loop_period` in the `Documentation-CHN/UserGuide/3-Server/4-Config Manual.md` should be `back_loop_period_in_second`.

> * `MAX_HEAP_SIZE` or `HEAP_NEWSIZE` are described in the `环境配置项` of `4-Config Manual.md`, but I can't find them in `iotdb-env.bat`.

> * `back_loop_period` in the `Documentation-CHN/UserGuide/3-Server/4-Config Manual.md` should be `back_loop_period_in_second`.

1. I have added these two parameters in `iotdb-env.bat` and test in the windows environment.
2. `tsfile-format.properties` is already merged into `iotdb-engine.properties` and I have removed its reference.
3. I have corrected its name.

Hi, I am considering how to do this better.
1. we need to know how to upload the docker image to apache docker hub.
2. I find that if we compile the source code locally and just upload the bin files to the docker, then the image size can reduce to ~80MB.

> Hi, I am considering how to do this better.
> 
> 1. we need to know how to upload the docker image to apache docker hub.
> 2. I find that if we compile the source code locally and just upload the bin files to the docker, then the image size can reduce to ~80MB.

+1, users can directly use `docker pull iotdb-version`.

According to this issue, https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-32.
We should also add Grafana service bin to image.

Big contribution!

- **压缩类型的编码**
  - 0: UNCOMPRESSED
  - 1: SNAPPY
  - 2: GZIP
  - 3: LZO
  - 4: SDT
  - 5: PAA
  - 6: PLA

Only the first two are implemented now, so it is better to add  "(not implement now)" for 3-6.

@qiaojialin 
hi, to enable the Internal Monitor, set ```enable_stat_monitor=true``` in the ```iotdb-engine.properties``` file before starting the IoTDB server service. Then the above metrics/time series will be created automatically and you can control the monitor data frequency and the data duration by setting some related parameters of the ```Statistics Monitor configuration``` section in the ```iotdb-engine.properties``` file.
